para.text: Stream Flow Routing Package
gwfsfrmodule.f
gwf2sfr7.f
GWFSFRMODULE
NEARZERO=1.0D-30
CLOSEZERO=1.0E-15
Version_sfr - identifies the version of SFR
THETAB
FLUXB
FLUXHLD2
NSS - Number of stream segments
NSTRM - The absolute value of NSTRM is the number of stream reaches. The sign is a flag used to determine whether or not to read other data.
NSFRPAR - Number of stream parameters
ISTCB1 - unit number for writing stream-aquifer leakage values
ISTCB2 - unit number for writing stream information on inflows and outflows
IUZT - Flag that is set to 1 if unsaturated flow is active.
MAXPTS - variable used to set the dimension of QSTAGE = 3*50
IRTFLG - If IRTFLG > 0 then streamflow will be routed using the kinematic-wave equation
NUMTIM - number of sub time steps used to route streamflow
ISFROPT - An integer value that defines the input structure
NSTRAIL - Number of trailing wave increments
ISUZN - The maximum number of vertical cells used to the define the unsaturated zone beneath a stream
NSFRSETS - The maximum number of different sets of trailing waves
NUZST - variable used in setting the dimensions of arrays related to unsaturated flow. It is set to the number of stream segments when unsaturated flow is used.
NSTOTRL - variable used in setting the dimensions of arrays related to unsaturated flow. It is set to ISUZN*NSTRAIL*NSFRSETS when unsaturated flow is used.
NUMAVE
ITMP -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: An integer value for reusing or reading stream segment data that can change each stress period.
IRDFLG -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: An integer value for printing input data specified for this stress period.
IPTFLG -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: An integer value for printing streamflow-routing results during this stress period.
NP -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: number of parameters used in the current stress period
CONST - A real value (or conversion factor) used in calculating stream depth for stream reach.
DLEAK - A real value equal to the closure tolerance for stream depth used to calculate leakage between each stream reach and active model cell.
WEIGHT - The time weighting factor used to calculate the change in channel storage
SFRRATIN - This variable is set but not used.
SFRRATOUT - This variable is set but not used.
FLWTOL - the streamflow tolerance for convergence of the kinematic wave equation used for transient streamflow routing.
STRMDELSTOR_CUM - This variable is set but not used.
STRMDELSTOR_RATE - This variable is set but not used.
TOTSPFLOW - This variable is set but not used.
IOTSG(NSS + nparseg) - An integer value of the downstream stream segment that receives tributary inflow from the last downstream reach of this segment.
NSEGCK(NSS) - NSEGCK is incremented each time a segment is defined. It is used to check that each segment is defined exactly one time.
ITRLSTH(NSTOTRL)
ISEG(1,*) - ICALC An integer value used to indicate method used to calculate stream depth in this segment.
ISEG(2,*) - NSTRPTS An integer value specified only when ICALC = 4. It is used to dimension a table relating streamflow with stream depth and width as specified in Items 4e and 6d.

ISEG(3,*) is set to 6 for segments that divert flow and to 5 for segments that neither divert flow nor receive tributary flow. It is set to 7 for segments that do not divert flow but do receive tributary flow.
ISEG(3,*) is set to as segment number
ISEG(4, jseg) - ireach

IDIVAR(1,*) - IUPSEG An integer value of the upstream segment from which water is diverted (or withdrawn) to supply inflow to this stream segment if this segment originates as a diversion from an upstream segment.

IDIVAR(2,*) - IPRIOR defines the prioritization system for diversion, such as when insufficient water is available to meet all diversion stipulations, and is used in conjunction with the value of FLOW [= SEG(2,*)].
ISTRM(1,*) - Layer
ISTRM(2,*) - Row
ISTRM(3,*) - Column
ISTRM(4,*) - Segment
ISTRM(5,*) - Reach
LTRLIT(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
LTRLST(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
ITRLIT(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
ITRLST(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
NWAVST(ISUZN,NUZST)
STRIN(NSS) - Outflow from segment for use in the Lake pacakge.
STROUT(NSS) - Flow from lake to stream segment.
FXLKOT(NSS) - Flow rate out of lake
UHC(NSTRM) - the vertical saturated hydraulic conductivity of the unsaturated zone.
SGOTFLW(NSS) - Outflow from previous segment
DVRSFLW(NSS) - Amount of flow diverted from a previous segment.
SFRUZBD(10)
SEG(1,*) - segment length
SEG(2,*) - FLOW streamflow (in units of volume per time) entering or leaving the upstream end of a stream segment (that is, into the first reach).
SEG(3,*) - volumetric rate of the diffuse overland runoff that enters the stream segment (in units of volume per time).
SEG(4,*) - the volumetric rate per unit area of water removed by evapotranspiration directly from the stream channel (in units of length per time).
SEG(5,*) - the volumetric rate per unit area of water added by precipitation directly on the stream channel (in units of length per time).
SEG(6,*) - Hc1fact A real number that is a factor used to calculate hydraulic conductivity of the streambed at the upstream end of this segment from the parameter value (in units of length per time).
SEG(7,*) - THICKM1 Thickness of streambed material at the upstream end of this segment (in units of length).
SEG(8,*) - ELEVUP Elevation of the top of the streambed at the upstream end of this segment (in units of length).
CDPTH the coefficient used in the equation that relates stream depth in all reaches in this segment to streamflow
WIDTH1 Average width of the stream channel at the upstream end of this segment (in units of length).
FDPTH the exponent used in the equation that relates stream depth in all reaches in this segment to streamflow.
DEPTH1 Average depth of water in the channel at the upstream end of this segment (units of length).
SEG(11,*) - HCOND2 Hydraulic conductivity of the streambed at the downstream end of this segment (units of length per time).
SEG(12,*) - THICKM2 Thickness of streambed material at the downstream end of this segment (in units of length).
SEG(13,*) - ELEVDN Elevation of the top of the streambed at the downstream end of this segment (in units of length).
AWDTH the coefficient used in the equation that relates stream width in all reaches in this segment to streamflow.
WIDTH2 Average width of the stream channel at the downstream end of this segment (in units of length).
BWDTH the exponent used in the equation that relates stream width in all reaches in this segment to streamflow.
DEPTH2 Average depth of water in the channel at the downstream end of this segment (units of length).
SEG(16,*) - Manning’s roughness coefficient for the channel in all reaches in this segment.
SEG(17,*) - Manning’s roughness coefficient for the overbank areas in all reaches in this segment.
SEG(18,*) - Saturated volumetric water content in the unsaturated zone beneath the upstream end of this segment
SEG(19,*) - Initial volumetric water content beneath the upstream end of this segment
SEG(20,*) - Brooks-Corey exponent used in the relation between water content and hydraulic conductivity within the unsaturated zone beneath the upstream end of this segment
SEG(21,*) - Vertical saturated hydraulic conductivity of the unsaturated zone beneath the upstream end of this segment
SEG(22,*) - Saturated volumetric water content in the unsaturated zone beneath the downstream end of this segment
SEG(23,*) - Initial volumetric water content beneath the downstream end of this segment.
SEG(24,*) - Brooks-Corey exponent used in the relation between water content and hydraulic conductivity within the unsaturated zone beneath the downstream end of this segment.
SEG(25,*) - Vertical saturated hydraulic conductivity of the unsaturated zone beneath the downstream end of this segment
SEG(26,*) - Used by UZF.
STRM(1,*) - RCHLEN A real number equal to the length of channel of the stream reach within this model cell.
STRM(2,*) - SLOPE A real number equal to the stream slope across the reach.
STRM(3,*)- STRTOP A real number equal to the top elevation of the streambed
STRM(4,*) - The elevation of the bottom of the streambed: STRTOP - STRTHICK
STRM(5,*) - The width of the stream reach
STRM(6,*) - STRHC1 A real number equal to the hydraulic conductivity of the streambed.
STRM(7,*) - The water depth of the stream reach
STRM(8,*) - STRTHICK A real number equal to the thickness of the streambed
STRM(9,*) - Outflow from the stream reach
STRM(10,*) - Inflow to the stream reach
STRM(11,*) - Flow through the streambed.
STRM(12,*) - volumetric runoff into the reach
STRM(13,*) - volumeteric ET rate for the reach
STRM(14,*) - volumeteric precipitation rate for the reach
STRM(15,*) - head in the stream reach OR top elevation of the streambed
STRM(16,*) - leakance? of the stream reach. Units = L
/T
STRM(17,*) - head difference
STRM(18,*) - head gradient across the stream bed
STRM(19,*) - head in the stream reach. (This variable is used by the Gage package.)
STRM(20,*) - (This variable is set but never used.)
STRM(21,*) - GW-Rech (This variable is used by the Gage package.)
STRM(22,*) - Chnge-UZ-Stor. (This variable is used by the Gage package.)
STRM(23,*) - Vol.-UZ-Stor.(This variable is used by the Gage package.)
STRM(24,*) - Exfiltrated flow into the stream reach (This variable is set by the UZF package.)
STRM(25,*) - a variable related to outflow from the stream reach
STRM(26,*) - a variable related to inflow into the stream reach.
STRM(27,*) - a variable related to outflow from the stream reach
STRM(28,*) - a variable related to inflow into the stream reach.
STRM(29,*) - a variable related to storage when routing flow downstream
STRM(30,*) - a variable related to storage when routing flow downstream
SFRQ(5,NSTRM) - Stores data that is written to an output file by the GAG package.
HWDTH(NSTRM,NUMTIM) - width of stream for sub time steps
HWTPRM(NSTRM,NUMTIM) - wetted perimeter of stream for sub time steps
QSTAGE(1..NSTRPTS, *) -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: FLOWTAB A real number that is the streamflow (units of volume per time) related to a given depth and width.
QSTAGE(NSTRPTS+11..2*NSTRPTS, *) -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: DPTHTAB A real number that is the average depth (units of length) corresponding to a given flow.
QSTAGE(2*NSTRPTS+1..3*NSTRPTS, *) -

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: WDTHTAB A real number that is the stream width (units of length) corresponding to a given flow.

XSEC(1..8,*) - XCPTi A real number that is the distance relative to the left bank of the stream channel (when looking downstream) for the eight points (XCPT1 through XCPT8) used to describe the geometry of this segment of the stream channel.
XSEC(9..16,*) - ZCPTi A real number that is the height relative to the top of the lowest elevation of the streambed (thalweg).
AVDPT(NUMAVE,NUZST)
AVWAT(NUMAVE,NUZST)
WAT1(NUMAVE,NUZST)
CONCQ(NSTRM,Nsol) - the solute concentration associated with "FLOW"
CONCRUN(NSTRM,Nsol) - the solute concentration in the overland runoff entering the stream segment.
CONCPPT(NSTRM,Nsol) - the solute concentration in precipitation that directly falls onto the stream surface.
THTS(NSTRM) - the saturated volumetric water content in the unsaturated zone
THTR(NSTRM) - residual water content
EPS(NSTRM) - the Brooks-Corey exponent used in the relation between water content and hydraulic conductivity within the unsaturated zone
FOLDFLBT(NSTRM)
THTI(NSTRM) - the initial volumetric water content
SUMLEAK(NSTRM) - leakance through the bottom of the channel
SUMRCH(NSTRM) - recharge to the water table.
HLDSFR(NSTRM) - groundwater head at the stream reach.
UZFLWT(ISUZN,NUZST)
UZSTOR(ISUZN,NUZST)
UZWDTH(ISUZN,NUZST)
UZSEEP(ISUZN,NUZST)
DELSTOR(ISUZN,NUZST)
WETPER(ISUZN,NUZST)
UZDPIT(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZDPST(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZTHIT(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZTHST(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZSPIT(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZSPST(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZFLIT(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZFLST(NSTOTRL,NUZST)
UZOLSFLX(ISUZN,NUZST)
HSTRM(NSTRM,NUMTIM) - Head in stream for sub time steps.
QSTRM(NSTRM,NUMTIM)
SLKOTFLW(200,NSS)
DLKOTFLW(200,NSS)
DLKSTAGE(200,NSS)
GWFSFRTYPE
ALLOCATE ARRAY STORAGE FOR STREAMS
INITIALIZE VARIABLES FOR SFR PACKAGES
READ STREAM DATA THAT IS CONSTANT FOR ENTIRE SIMULATION:
REACH DATA AND PARAMETER DEFINITIONS
SETS UNSATURATED VERTICAL HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY TO VERTICAL HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY IN THE LAYER-PROPERTY FLOW PACKAGE.
READ STREAM DATA FOR STRESS PERIOD
ADD STREAM TERMS TO RHS AND HCOF IF FLOW OCCURS IN MODEL CELL
CALCULATE VOLUMETRIC GROUND-WATER BUDGET FOR STREAMS AND SUM STREAMFLOWS IN MODELED AREA
CALCULATE ARRAYS OF LAKE STAGE, FLOW, AND THE DERIVATIVE OF FLOWS FOR STREAM SEGMENTS THAT HAVE INFLOWS DETERMINED BY LAKE STAGE
COMPUTES DIVERSIONS FROM AN UPSTREAM SEGMENT
PRINTS MASS BALANCE FOR ENTIRE UNSATURATED ZONE
COMPUTE STREAM DEPTH GIVEN FLOW USING 8-POINT CROSS SECTION
COMPUTE FLOW IN STREAM GIVEN DEPTH USING 8-POINT CROSS SECTION
COMPUTE DEPTH AND WIDTH IN STREAM GIVEN FLOW USING RATING TABLES.
COMPUTE FLOW AND WIDTH IN STREAM GIVEN DEPTH USING RATING TABLES
READ STREAM SEGMENT DATA -- parameters or non parameters
MOVE STREAM PARAMETER DATA INTO ACTIVE SEGMENTS
PRINT STREAM SEGMENT DATA -- parameters or non parameters
DEFINE UNSATURATED CELLS TO ACCOMMODATE STREAM LOSS.
COMPUTE INFLOW, OUTFLOW, AND CHANGE IN STORAGE IN UNSATURATED ZONE BENEATH STREAMBED.
ROUTE UNSATURATED ZONE WAVES DURING MODEL ITERATIONS CALLED FROM SUBROUTINE GWF2SFR7FM
ROUTE UNSATURATED-ZONE WAVES AFTER FINAL ITERATION CALLED FROM SUBROUTINE GWF2SFR7BD
WAVE INTERACTION WITHIN AN UNSATURATED FLOW COMPARTMENT
CREATE LEAD WAVE WHEN THE SURFACE FLUX INCREASES AND ROUTE WAVES
INITIALIZE A NEW SET OF TRAIL WAVES WHEN SURFACE FLUX DECREASES
COMPARTMENTALIZE UNSATURATED ZONE BENEATH STREAMBED ON BASIS OF EIGHT POINT CROSS SECTION WHEN ICALC IS 2
IMPLICIT FINITE-DIFFERENCE SCHEME TO ROUTE FLOW DOWN CHANNELS
Save SFR data for a grid.
Change SFR data to a different grid.
Save SFR data for a grid.
CALCUNSATFLOBOT
DEFINE UNSATURATED CELLS TO ACCOMMODATE STREAM LOSS.
